cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles north of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the southeastern Gulf of Mexico and forecast to curve northwest toward the Texas–Louisiana Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas–Louisiana border (around Lake Charles / Port Arthur)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from San Luis Pass TX to Ocean Springs MS; hurricane watch Port Bolivar TX to west of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warning for western Cuba provinces and lower Florida Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Cuba’s northwest coast, Florida Keys, and the central-to-northwestern U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: No significant tropical-cyclone winds expected at San Juan as Laura remains far to the west
weather_observation.rainfall: Only scattered passing showers; heavy rainfall core stays well west of Puerto Rico
